problem.p: Variable names can now include primes at the end! Here, the answer is "x'+v*t" (a Galilean change of coordinate).
problem.script: from mitxgraders import * grader = FormulaGrader( answers="x'+v*t", variables=["x'", 'v', 't'] )
problem.p: You can also use tensor notation for variable names. Here, the answer is "T_{x}^{13} + 2*T_{y}^{13}". Notice that the preview box styles these correctly. The caret to indicate raised indices is not confused with the caret to indicate powers.
problem.script: from mitxgraders import * grader2 = FormulaGrader( answers="T_{x}^{13}+2*T_{y}^{13}", variables=['T_{x}^{13}', 'T_{y}^{13}'] )
